content: First, I would recommend starting with simply observing your breath. This is a common practice in Vipassana meditation and can help to anchor your mind in the present moment. From there, you can begin to observe sensations in the body and expand your mindfulness to include those as well. Remember, the core concept of Buddhism is the Four Noble Truths, and Vipassana meditation is a way to gain insight into these truths and ultimately achieve the state of nirvana. Be patient with yourself and keep practicing consistently. May you find peace and understanding on your meditation journey.
